At-a-Glance: Spotty brood, scattered drones in worker cells, and persistent queen cells point to a failing or absent queen.
Why it Matters: Late recognition leads to population collapse just as flows arrive or winter approaches.
Step-by-Step: Confirm status: look for eggs/larvae; assess brood pattern and behaviour (nervous ‘roar’). If failing: remove old queen, introduce a caged, mated queen with candy release in the brood area; check acceptance and egg-laying after a few days.
Common Pitfalls: Introducing a new queen without removing the old; skipping acclimatisation; attempting requeening during severe dearth with aggressive colonies.
Tools & Materials: Marked queens/queen cells, introduction cages, fondant, and calm technique.
